availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert Nicholas Winn (Clark County, Kentucky, banker)

body.p: Clark County, Kentucky, banker. Clark County, Kentucky, native. Son of Philip B. Winn. Married Mary Jane Brassfield Winn. Father of Eliza S. Winn, Philip B. Winn, James Winn and Molly Winn. Deputy sheriff in Clark County, Kentucky. Resident of Clark County in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Clark County in 1850. Banker in Clark County in 1860. Partner with William Winn and James Simpson in the Deposit Bank of Winn, Simpson & Co. in Clark County. Owned three enslaved people in Clark County in 1860. Confirmed as a notary public in Clark County on February 5, 1861.
